metadata.title: CVE-2021-1844 on Ubuntu 21.10 (impish) - medium.
metadata.description:
A memory corruption issue was addressed with improved validation. This issue is fixed in iOS 14.4.1 and iPadOS 14.4.1, Safari 14.0.3 (v. 14610.4.3.1.7 and 15610.4.3.1.7), watchOS 7.3.2, macOS Big Sur 11.2.3. Processing maliciously crafted web content may lead to arbitrary code execution.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo ua fix CVE-2021-1844` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.32.0-1ubuntu3
No subscription required

notes.note: jdstrand> webkit receives limited support. For details, see https://wiki.ubuntu.com/SecurityTeam/FAQ#webkit webkit in Ubuntu uses the JavaScriptCore (JSC) engine, not V8

criterions.comment: qtwebkit-opensource-src package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
webkit2gtk package in impish was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.32.0-1ubuntu3').
wpewebkit package in impish is affected and may need fixing.
